Articles.Content: This may be what you are wanting: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/blog.php/81152-johnsonwax

Welding a seat in wont work, and won't solve the problem. You'll need to model a custom seat (or use the stock seat model if you can get your hands on it to add it to your own) then code the seat into the cage in unity. We did this for the KerbolQuest jetpack, as well as using the extended seat code Razchek is working on to increase seatbelt strength.

Welding a seat in wont work, and won't solve the problem. You'll need to model a custom seat (or use the stock seat model if you can get your hands on it to add it to your own) then code the seat into the cage in unity. We did this for the KerbolQuest jetpack, as well as using the extended seat code Razchek is working on to increase seatbelt strength.

Off topic, but do you have a link to that jetpack, it sounds awesome

It's still in development, and its a quest item you'll receive for finishing chapter 1 of quest 1, our initial release. Won't be useable unless you complete the short quest line. I'll be posting an in development thread for KQ soon, a couple big things to finish up first

Here's the jetpack thread tho

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/44960-Project-Showcase-Sneak-Peek-of-KerbolQuest-Now-with-full-length-video

Edited August 27, 2013 by HoY
Hey, where can we download this piece? I see that I'm kind of necroing, but this looks really useful and as it's just a structural part it should load in .23
Scroll up no more than ten posts and you'll see a release link for V1.0. And yes, they do work flawlessly in 0.23.

Can I do anything to make them less slippery?

Car all the time turns from side to side=(
It looks like it has, @angusmcbeth hasn't been around for a while, so I better close this, I'll reopen it when he returns.
